narrative.title: 21 Panzer Division - 1942Q1
narrative.situation: German Panzer Division deployed in North Africa during 1942Q1.
narrative.objectives: Panzer division for mobile operations in North Africa. Full panzer division structure (vs 'leichte' Q2 1941) with two infantry regiments, three-battalion artillery regiment, standard reconnaissance/AT/engineer/signals battalions. Heavier and more capable than 5. leichte Division but still lighter than European panzer divisions. Primary roles: mobile offense (Jan 1942 counter-offensive), exploitation, mobile defense. Rebuilt after Operation Crusader (Nov-Dec 1941) devastation.
narrative.axis_objective: Maintain defensive positions and inflict maximum casualties on Allied forces.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and secure strategic objectives while minimizing casualties.

weather.terrain: Coastal desert (Cyrenaica) - sand, gravel, rocky escarpments, wadis. Q1 1942 operations: Mersa el Brega → Agedabia → Benghazi → Gazala Line defensive positions.

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Mobile desert warfare with combined arms coordination
Rapid exploitation and pursuit (Jan 1942 counter-offensive: Mersa el Brega → Benghazi in 9 days)
88mm FlaK dual-role (AA and devastating AT) - effective vs all British armor
Self-propelled AA battalion for mobile air defense
Extensive reconnaissance capability (Aufklärungs-Abteilung 3 with armored cars, motorcycles)
Mobile workshops for battlefield repairs (critical post-Crusader)
Superior tank quality: Pz.III Ausf J long 50mm outranges British Crusader/Valentine
